posts.name:
Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor
Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor
posts.content:
𝗔𝗿𝗲 𝗬𝗼𝘂 𝗨𝗻𝗸𝗻𝗼𝘄𝗶𝗻𝗴𝗹𝘆 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗽𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝗨𝗻𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗲𝗱 𝗖𝘆𝗰𝗹𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝗣𝗮𝗶𝗻?

I’ve been there, stuck in the same patterns, wondering why I couldn’t break free.

Then I discovered the key to healing.

Have you ever found yourself repeating the same argument, blurting out words you instantly regret?

Or staying silent, wishing you had the courage to speak up, but holding back out of fear?

As leaders, we’re often expected to have it all together.

We’re expected to make the right decisions, guide others with clarity, and model resilience.

But beneath the surface, personal struggles can seep into professional spaces, affecting how we lead, communicate, and connect.

𝗛𝗲𝗿𝗲’𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘁𝗿𝘂𝘁𝗵:
Many of the challenges we face in relationships, both personal and professional, aren’t just about the present moment.

They’re echoes of unresolved childhood wounds that still influence us today.

Those unhealed patterns can show up in ways we don’t even realize:

The colleague who triggers us, reminding us of past conflicts.

The fear of confrontation that keeps us from making tough calls.

The perfectionism or people-pleasing tendencies that stem from a need for validation we never received.

𝗙𝗼𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀:
Emotions rise quickly, often driven by fears of rejection or abandonment.
You feel deeply, and when triggered,
those emotions can lead you to react impulsively, sometimes in ways you regret.

𝗙𝗼𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗼𝗿𝘀:
You hold back your feelings, afraid of being hurt or rejected.
You create distance to protect yourself,
but it often leaves you feeling isolated and disconnected from those you care about.

𝗔𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗱𝘆 𝘁𝗼 𝗯𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗸 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝘆𝗰𝗹𝗲?
1. Recognize the Pattern:
The first step to change is awareness.
Start by identifying the recurring patterns in your relationships and reaction

2. Get Curious About the Root Cause:
Many of our struggles are tied to unresolved childhood wounds

3. Rewire the Reaction:
Once you’ve identified the trigger,
take intentional steps to respond more constructively.
(I can guide you through this)

The good news?
You don’t have to stay trapped in these cycles.

When you begin to understand the roots of your reactions,
you unlock the freedom to lead with authenticity,
connect with others on a deeper level, and show up as the best version of yourself.

Take a moment to reflect:
Are you more of a Reactor or a Suppressor?
What’s one small action you can take today to start breaking free?

𝗥𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗯𝗲𝗿: 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗝𝗼𝘂𝗿𝗻𝗲𝘆, 𝗡𝗼𝘁 𝗮 𝗗𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻

What’s your next step toward healing?
Let me know in the comments below

Found this helpful? Repost to share with your network. ️
Followfor more insights on career and leadership growth. ️

comments.commentText:
Bonus Point #1
𝗧𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗶𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴
It’s easy to blame external circumstances, but true healing begins when you own your part in the cycle. Accepting responsibility for your growth is empowering.
comments.userName: Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor

comments.commentText:
Bonus Point #2 
𝗘𝗺𝗯𝗿𝗮𝗰𝗲 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀
Healing takes time, and it’s not about perfection. Be patient with yourself as you navigate through your past wounds to create a stronger, more authentic future.
comments.userName: Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor

posts.commentAdded: This resonates deeply! Self-awareness is truly the first step to breaking those cycles. Excited to explore this journey of healing further!

posts.name:
Mike Philie
Mike Philie
posts.content:
A 1914 blast from the past!  Back when First Class postage was just 2 cents. 

Print has a unique way of preserving memories, and it’s amazing how these treasures stand the test of time.

Shoutout to Syracuse institution HJ Howe Jewelers—this beautiful calendar book was found among my mother’s belongings, and I couldn’t resist keeping it intact.

And a nod to Livermore & Knight, renowned for their "small format" books and postcard printing since the 1890s. Their craftsmanship truly made history.

Let’s continue celebrating the timeless power of print!
posts.commentAdded: What a fantastic piece of history! Its inspiring to see how print preserves our memories. Cheers to the art and craftsmanship behind it! 📚✨

posts.content:
The Embark Program by Edelweiss Mutual Fund was designed to empower the next generation of Mutual Fund Distributors (MFDs) with the tools, insights, and confidence to thrive in the dynamic world of investments.

Through this 10-week immersive journey, participants gained valuable insights into Sales, Marketing, Investments, Risk & Compliance, and more, shaping them into future leaders of the financial industry. 

Here is what Embark batch has to say on their incredible journey!

comments.commentText: Embarked, explored, and left with a sharper view of the industry. Solid program, great people, and insights that stick. Appreciate the opportunity.
Incredible learning experience! So grateful for the opportunity at Edelweiss.

posts.commentAdded: Inspiring initiative! Excited to see how the Embark Program empowers the next wave of leaders in the financial industry! 🌟 #FutureLeaders

posts.name:
Alex Turnbull
Alex Turnbull
posts.content:
We need to build a new playbook for modern company building.

"Learn to build content" is the new "learn to build software".

And I mean truly integrated content:

Owning attention

Driving feedback loops

Shipping daily where your audience lives

When social platforms exploded in 2020, they didn't just change creator economics.

1. Suddenly founders could build direct relationships with millions.

2. Companies could own their entire narrative.

3. Products could evolve in real-time with user feedback.

4. No more gatekeepers, no more PR games, no more begging TechCrunch for coverage.

Think about it. "Learn to code" used to be the ultimate founder hack.

But that playbook is dying right in front of us.

The new playbook isn't just about shipping features.

Content isn't just marketing anymore–it's the foundation of everything.

This is about mastering the full stack: viral mechanics, hook psychology, feedback systems.

Imagine TikTok's virality meets YC's company building.

From native social understanding to scientific growth engines.

We're not just building better software.

We should be building deeper connections at scale.

This isn't about better products.This is about owning the entire value chain.

The next wave isn't about democratizing code.

It's about democratizing audience building.

The next great business transformation isn't technical.

It's about building compound value through content.

And AI just made all of this possible with virtually zero marginal cost.

Here's what tomorrow's founding teams actually look like:

- A social savant who understands virality at a genetic level.

- A content scientist who optimizes hooks with the precision of a neurosurgeon.

- A talent architect who builds and scales creator pipelines systematically.

The old playbook is dead.

Vertical integration is inevitable.

The audience comes first.

Everything else follows.

This changes everything. And it's already starting.

comments.commentText:
Alex Turnbull I totally agree with this but where does this leave us?

Between coding and content creation, what tools should one master for the latter? Adobe? Canva? What do you use?

And then in terms of platform, which one do you recommend people should start with? Is it about creating a personal brand now or launching a company profile and creating a brand around that?

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely spot on! Embracing content as the foundation for building connections is the key to thriving in todays landscape. Exciting times ahead! 🚀
